item.name: Available Real Memory
item.description:
Real Memory Available
OID: .1.3.6.1.4.1.2021.4.6
The amount of real/physical memory currently unused or available.
http://www.net-snmp.org/docs/mibs/ucdavis.html

item.name: Available Swap Memory
item.description:
Real Memory Available
OID: .1.3.6.1.4.1.2021.4.4
The amount of swap space currently unused or available.
http://www.net-snmp.org/docs/mibs/ucdavis.html

item.name: Buffered Memory
item.description:
Shared Memory
OID: .1.3.6.1.4.1.2021.4.14
The total amount of real or virtual memory currently allocated for use as memory buffers.
http://www.net-snmp.org/docs/mibs/ucdavis.html

item.name: Cached Memory
item.description:
Shared Memory
OID: .1.3.6.1.4.1.2021.4.15
The total amount of real or virtual memory currently allocated for use as cached memory.
http://www.net-snmp.org/docs/mibs/ucdavis.html

item.name: Minimum Swap Memory
item.description:
OID: .1.3.6.1.4.1.2021.4.12
The minimum amount of swap space expected to be kept free or available during normal operation of this host.
If this value (as reported by 'memAvailSwap(4)') falls below the specified level, then 'memSwapError(100)' will be set to 1 and an error message made available via 'memSwapErrorMsg(101)'.
http://www.net-snmp.org/docs/mibs/ucdavis.html

item.name: Shared Memory
item.description:
Shared Memory
OID: .1.3.6.1.4.1.2021.4.13
The total amount of real or virtual memory currently allocated for use as shared memory.
http://www.net-snmp.org/docs/mibs/ucdavis.html

item.name: Swap Error
item.description:
OID: .1.3.6.1.4.1.2021.4.100
Indicates whether the amount of available swap space (as reported by 'memAvailSwap(4)'), is less than the desired minimum (specified by 'memMinimumSwap(12)').
http://www.net-snmp.org/docs/mibs/ucdavis.html

item.name: Swap Error Message
item.description:
OID: .1.3.6.1.4.1.2021.4.101
Describes whether the amount of available swap space (as reported by 'memAvailSwap(4)'), is less than the desired minimum (specified by 'memMinimumSwap(12)').
http://www.net-snmp.org/docs/mibs/ucdavis.html

item.name: Total Memory Free
item.description:
Available Swap Available
OID: .1.3.6.1.4.1.2021.4.11
The total amount of memory free or available for use on this host. This value typically covers both real memory and swap space or virtual memory.
http://www.net-snmp.org/docs/mibs/ucdavis.html

item.name: Total Real Memory
item.description:
Total Memory Available
OID: .1.3.6.1.4.1.2021.4.5
The total amount of real/physical memory allocated for text pages on this host.
http://www.net-snmp.org/docs/mibs/ucdavis.html

item.name: Total Swap Memory
item.description:
Total Memory Available
OID: .1.3.6.1.4.1.2021.4.3
The total amount of swap space configured for this host.
http://www.net-snmp.org/docs/mibs/ucdavis.html

discovery_rule.name: Datasets
discovery_rule.description: Discover the datasets available on the FreeNAS system

item_prototype.name: Allocation Unit size in bytes on dataset {#SNMPVALUE}
Available units on dataset {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description:
The available units of each dataset. Needs multiplying by datasetAllocationUnits
The OID for this is .1.3.6.1.4.1.50536.1.2.1.1.3

item_prototype.name: Usage of dataset {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: Used percentage of the datasets capacity

item_prototype.name: Size of dataset {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The size of each dataset - in units.

item_prototype.name: Used Bytes on dataset {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The used units in each dataset.

trigger_prototype.name: Dataset {#SNMPVALUE} usage is over 70%
trigger_prototype.description: Your dataset is starting to get full. You might want to increase it's quota or increase the disk space.

item_prototype.name: Current Read bandwidth on pool {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The bandwidth of all read operations (including metadata), expressed as units per second (over 1 second interval)

item_prototype.name: Read bandwidth on pool {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The bandwidth of all read operations (including metadata), expressed as units per second (averaged since system booted)

item_prototype.name: Current Write bandwidth on pool {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The bandwidth of all write operations, expressed as units per second (over 1 second interval).

item_prototype.name: Write bandwidth on pool {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The bandwidth of all write operations, expressed as units per second (averaged since system booted).

item_prototype.name: IO Read Ops on pool {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The number of read I/O operations sent to the pool or device, including metadata requests (averaged since system booted).

item_prototype.name: Current IO Read Ops on pool {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The number of read I/O operations sent to the pool or device, including metadata requests (over 1 second interval).

item_prototype.name: IO Write Ops on pool {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The number of write I/O operations sent to the pool or device (averaged since system booted).

item_prototype.name: Current IO Write Ops on pool {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The number of write I/O operations sent to the pool or device (over 1 second interval).

item_prototype.name: Allocation Unit size in bytes on pool {#SNMPVALUE}
Total size in Bytes of pool {#SNMPVALUE}
Available units on pool {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description:
The number of available units on the pool.
This needs to be multiplied by the datasetAllocationUnits.
The OID for this is .1.3.6.1.4.1.50536.1.2.1.1.3

item_prototype.name: Usage of pool {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: Used percentage of the pools capacity

item_prototype.name: Total size in units of pool {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The size of the pool in allocation units.

item_prototype.name: Used units on pool {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The number of used allocation units in the pool.

item_prototype.name: Health of pool {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The current health of the containing pool, as reported by zpool status. online(0), degraded(1), faulted(2), offline(3), unavail(4), removed(5)

item_prototype.name: Name of pool #$1
item_prototype.description: The name of the ZFS Pool

trigger_prototype.name: Pool {#SNMPVALUE} is DEGRADED!
trigger_prototype.description: Your pool {#SNMPVALUE} is in degraded state. online(0), degraded(1), faulted(2), offline(3), unavail(4), removed(5)

trigger_prototype.name: Pool {#SNMPVALUE} is FAULTED!
trigger_prototype.description: Your pool {#SNMPVALUE} is in faulted state. You are in trouble

trigger_prototype.name: Pool {#SNMPVALUE} is in OFFLINE state
trigger_prototype.description: Your pool {#SNMPVALUE} is in offline state. Maybe your pool is locked?

trigger_prototype.name: Pool {#SNMPVALUE} is in REMOVED state
trigger_prototype.description: Your pool {#SNMPVALUE} is in removed state.

trigger_prototype.name: Pool {#SNMPVALUE} is in UNAVAILABLE state
trigger_prototype.description: Your pool {#SNMPVALUE} is in unavailable state.

trigger_prototype.name: Pool {#SNMPVALUE} usage is over 80%
trigger_prototype.description: Your pool {#SNMPVALUE} is more than 80% full! It is a known fact that performance will degrade significantly. Please free up some space.

discovery_rule.name: ZVols
discovery_rule.description: Find all the zvols on the FreeNAS system

item_prototype.name: Allocation Unit size in bytes on zvol {#SNMPVALUE}
Available Bytes on zvol {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The available units of each zvol.

item_prototype.name: Usage of zvol {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: Used percentage of the zvols capacity

item_prototype.name: Size of zvol {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The size of each zvol.

item_prototype.name: Used units on zvol {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The used units in each zvol.

trigger_prototype.name: Zvol {#SNMPVALUE} usage is over 70%
trigger_prototype.description: The zvol is getting full, you may want to increase its space.

trigger.name: Swap Error on {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description: Indicates whether the amount of available swap space (as reported by 'memAvailSwap(4)'), is less than the desired minimum (specified by 'memMinimumSwap(12)').
